CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. 5, reads: "Storybook Artist Is Favorite With Children - The story-book artist for scores of children at the West End Branch of the Carnegie Library is 35-year-old Theodore Hamiel. Responding to the request of Miss Patricia Hays (top left photo), who had discovered his talents, Mr. Hamiel has been painting story-book characters, like those in top left photo.  His work has greatly enlivened interest in a weekly story telling hour.  In the other photos, Mr. Hamiel is shown with some of his other paintings which he explains as "just puttering around in paint." - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Patricia Hays observing artist Theodore Hamiel painting storybook figures on cabinets in basement of West End branch of Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh
